visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing monthly performance metrics of two product lines using synthetic time-series data with seasonal variation
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time series (12 monthly observations each) comparing sales performance. Synthetic data was generated with μ=110±25 for electronics (seasonal summer peak) and μ=85±15 for equipment (Q4 emphasis), maintaining domain-appropriate value ranges and temporal patterns. The line chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while preserving meaningful comparison capabilities. Color choices (#3498db for tech, #e74c3c for industrial) follow Cairo's preattentive processing principles for immediate series differentiation. Proportional axis labeling and circular/square markers enhance visual discrimination without cognitive overload, aligning with Tufte's principles of graphical integrity.
